case_vignette: a 14-year-old male presenting to dermatology clinic with rosy cheeks and a history of easy sunburns and frequent respiratory infections. physical examination demonstrates a prominent nose and ears, telangiectatic erythema in a malar distribution, and faint hypopigmentation on the cheeks.  genetic testing is performed and reveals a blm/recql3 mutation.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rosy cheeks and I get sunburned easily.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for a while now.
Do you also experience flushing, visible blood vessels, or acne-like bumps on your cheeks?
No, I just have rosy cheeks and visible blood vessels on my face.
Do you have any skin sensitivity or irritation associated with these symptoms?
No, I don't have skin sensitivity or irritation.
Does anyone in your family have similar symptoms or any known skin conditions?
I'm not aware of any family members with similar symptoms or known skin conditions.
Have you used any new skincare products or medications that could have triggered these symptoms?
No, I haven't used any new skincare products or medications that could have triggered these symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Rosacea

I have rosy cheeks and I burn easily in the sun, also I've been getting sick with respiratory infections more often than usual.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for a while now.

Yes, I also have some light-colored patches on my cheeks and visible small blood vessels in a butterfly pattern across my face.

No, I haven't noticed any joint pain or muscle weakness.

I'm not sure about any family history of similar symptoms or autoimmune diseases.

No, I have not been diagnosed with any other medical conditions, and I'm not on any medications currently.
Final Diagnosis: Lupus erythematosus (Cutaneous Lupus)
